newsitem.title: USA: Nabors to merge with private drilling co.
newsitem.headline: Nabors to merge with private drilling co.

text.p: Nabors Industries said Monday that it has executed a definitive agreement to merge with Adcor-Nicklos Drilling Co in a stock swap.
All Adcor-Nicklos stock will be exchanged for 3.4 million shares of Nabors common stock, Nabors said.
Nabors shares gained 3/8 early Monday afternoon to 20-3/8.
The deal is expected to close in January.
Adcor-Nicklos has 30 active and six stacked rigs. The rigs are in Texas, Arkoma, the Rocky Mountain region and the Williston basin.

Separately, Nabors said its board has decided to rescind the company's stock repurchase plan because a recent Securities and Exchange Commission bulletin has created uncertainties for using pooling-of-interest accounting.
Nabors said it has not bought back any shares since the plan was authorized in December 1995.
